title: Build Skill Sync responsive multi-page UI with auth, credits, feedback, and dark mode

requirements.text: Create a responsive app shell with a modern navbar that includes the “Skill Sync” logo, primary navigation (Home, Skill Match, Dashboard), and Login/Logout entry points.

quotes: Pages Required: 1) Home Page ... 2) Dashboard Page ... 4) Skill Match Page

acceptanceCriteria: Navbar renders on all pages and collapses appropriately on mobile (e.g., hamburger menu).
Logo text reads “Skill Sync” and is consistently styled.
Navigation highlights the active page and routes work without full page reloads.

requirements.text: Implement a Home page with: hero heading “Learn. Teach. Earn. Grow Together.”, a short subheading explaining the peer-to-peer skill exchange concept, CTA buttons (“Start Learning”, “Start Teaching”), a Features section (Live Classes, Credit System, Smart Matching, Doubt Solving), a 3-step “How It Works” section with icons, a Testimonials section, and a Footer with social links and contact info.

quotes:
Home Page
- Hero section with heading:
  "Learn. Teach. Earn. Grow Together."
- Subheading explaining skill exchange concept
- Call-to-action buttons: "Start Learning" and "Start Teaching"
- Features section (Live Classes, Credit System, Smart Matching, Doubt Solving)
- How It Works (3 step section with icons)
- Testimonials section
- Footer with social links and contact info

acceptanceCriteria: All listed Home sections are present, visually distinct, and responsive.
CTA buttons are clickable and route users to appropriate pages (e.g., Skill Match for learning and Dashboard for teaching) or prompt login if required.
Footer includes at least: an email contact, and 2–3 social link placeholders.

requirements.text: Create Login and Signup UI flows using Internet Identity for authentication; treat “Signup” as first-time profile setup after a successful Internet Identity login (collect name and skills).
acceptanceCriteria: Login button triggers Internet Identity authentication and results in an authenticated session in the UI.
Signup screen is reachable for first-time users and allows saving a basic profile (name + skills).
Authenticated state is reflected in the navbar (e.g., shows user menu and Logout).

requirements.text: Create a Dashboard page (post-login) with: profile section (Name, Skills, Credits), “Book a Session” button, upcoming sessions list, earned credits display, and feedback ratings summary (1–5 stars).

quotes:
Dashboard Page (After Login)
- Profile section (Name, Skills, Credits)
- Book a Session button
- Upcoming sessions
- Earned credits display
- Feedback ratings

acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard requires login; unauthenticated users are redirected to Login.
Profile shows name, a skills list/chips, and a numeric credits balance.
Upcoming sessions list renders with at least: skill/topic, partner name (or placeholder), date/time, and status.
Feedback ratings are displayed as star visuals (1–5) with an average rating.

requirements.text: Create a Skill Match page with a search bar, a set of skill categories (including Coding, Design, Music, Language), and match cards that show rating and credit cost, plus an action to request/book a session.

quotes:
Skill Match Page
- Search bar
- Skill categories (Coding, Design, Music, Language, etc.)
- Match cards with ratings and credit cost

acceptanceCriteria: Search filters match cards by name/skill text (client-side is acceptable).
Category selection filters the visible match cards.
Each match card displays: user/mentor name placeholder, skill(s), star rating, and a credit cost value.
Clicking “Book/Request Session” prompts login if not authenticated, otherwise leads to a booking flow or creates an upcoming session entry.

requirements.text: Create a Live Class page UI with: a video call placeholder area, a session duration timer, a feedback submission form (1–5 stars + comment), and a credit calculation display based on session duration and feedback rating.

quotes:
Live Class Page
- Video call UI placeholder
- Timer showing session duration
- Feedback submission form
- Credit calculation display

Functional Requirements:
- Credit points system display
- Feedback rating system (1–5 stars)

acceptanceCriteria: Live class page shows a clearly labeled video placeholder region (no real video integration required).
Timer can be started/stopped for a session and displays elapsed time in a readable format.
Feedback form allows selecting 1–5 stars and entering a comment; submission persists to backend for the session.
Credit calculation display updates based on timer duration and selected rating and shows the resulting credits earned/spent.

requirements.text: Implement backend data models and API endpoints in the single Motoko actor to support: user profile (name, skills, credits), sessions (create/list/update status), feedback (store rating/comment linked to a session), and a deterministic credit calculation function based on duration and rating.

quotes: earn credit points based on feedback and session duration, and use those credits to learn new skills

Functional Requirements:
- Credit points system display
- Feedback rating system (1–5 stars)

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes methods to: get/create/update the current user profile; list upcoming sessions for the current user; create a session request/booking; submit feedback for a session; compute credits earned/spent.
Credit calculation is deterministic and returns the same result for the same duration + rating inputs.
API methods enforce that only the authenticated principal can mutate its own profile/sessions/feedback.

requirements.text: Apply a clean, youth-focused visual design across all pages with a soft blue+purple gradient background, card-based layout, modern typography, and smooth hover/transition animations for buttons, cards, and navigation.

quotes:
Design Requirements:
- Clean, modern UI
- Youth-focused design
- Soft gradient background (blue + purple)
- Smooth animations and hover effects
Add smooth animations and modern UI components.

acceptanceCriteria: All primary surfaces use a consistent card style (spacing, radius, shadow) and look cohesive across pages.
Gradient background is present and does not reduce text readability (adequate contrast).
Interactive components (buttons/cards/nav links) have visible hover/focus states and smooth transitions.
Layout is responsive and usable on mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints.

requirements.text: Add a dark mode option with a theme toggle that persists the user’s preference and updates the gradient/background and component colors appropriately.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme toggle is accessible from the navbar (or equivalent global location).
Theme choice persists across refreshes (e.g., local storage) and applies on initial load.
Dark mode maintains readability and consistent styling for cards, text, and controls.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no multi-canister backend design).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable template paths; only compose them.
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Implementing real video calling or live streaming on the Live Class page (placeholder UI only).
Real-time chat, WebSockets, or push notifications.
External database integrations or third-party authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.
A production-grade smart matching algorithm; basic filtering and placeholder match data are sufficient.

required: Modern minimal wordmark logo reading “Skill Sync” on transparent background (skill-sync-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Abstract soft gradient background with subtle shapes, blue-to-purple, no text (skillsync-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
Set of 4 minimal line icons (live class, credits, matching, doubt solving) in a consistent style (skillsync-icons-sprite.dim_1024x256.png)
